Package com.sicomsa.dmt.solicitude.batch

Class Batch

java.lang.Object
com.sicomsa.dmt.solicitude.batch.Batch
public class Batch extends Object
Batch downloads all available digital certificates (CFDIs) from the BatchSolicitudes it receives through a map; and saves the download status of each solicitude in a file that can be uploaded later and continue each download process where it left off.

This is usually done in parts and at different times since the web service generally does not have all the information ready to be downloaded instantly.

Since:
1.0
Version:
2025.01.02
Author:
Beto Lopez

  • Constructor Details

    • Batch

      public Batch(File file, Map<Long,BatchSolicitude> batchMap)
      Creates a new Batch that will write web servide responses to the specified file, and will able to download BatchSolicitudes included in the specified map.

      The specified file must exist and have been build by a BatchFactory.

      Parameters:
      file - existing file built from a BatchFactory.
      batchMap - map of batch solicitudes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if file of batchMap are null

    • download

      public void download(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn) throws BatchException
      Tries to download all pending solicitudes of this batch, saving all solicitude's states and responses to its file so it can be reloaded in the future with another Batch instance.
      Parameters:
      conn - SOAPConnection to use
      Throws:
      BatchException - if there was a batch error
      NullPointerException - if conn is null

    • doDownload

      protected void doDownload(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn) throws BatchException, jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException, IOException
      Tries to download all pending solicitudes of this batch, writing all responses received from the web service in this batch's file.

      This method will halt the download process of any solicitude that was paused, delayed or rejected. And will continue with the rest until they are halted or all of its certificates have been downloaded.

      Parameters:
      conn - SOAPConnection to use
      Throws:
      BatchException - if any problems arose while downloading a solicitude.
      jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPException - if there were any SOAP problems
      IOException - if there was an I/O error
      IllegalArgumentException - if conn is null

    • downloadAllPending

      protected void downloadAllPending(jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPConnection conn, DownloadListener listener) throws BatchException
      Tries to download all pending solicitudes of this batch.

      This method will halt the download process of any solicitude that was paused, delayed or rejected. And will continue with the rest until they are halted or all of its certificates have been downloaded.

      The specified listener will be added to all the solicitudes that will be downloaded, and will be removed from them before this method exits.

      Parameters:
      conn - SOAPConnection to use
      listener - to add to solicitudes to download
      Throws:
      BatchException - if any problems arose while downloading a solicitude.
      IllegalArgumentException - if conn is null

    • verifyCredentials

      protected void verifyCredentials() throws CertificateExpiredException, CertificateNotYetValidException
      Checks certificate's validity of all clients with pending solicitudes in this Batch.
      Throws:
      CertificateExpiredException - if any client's certifiate is expired
      CertificateNotYetValidException - if any client's certiticate is not yet valid

    • checkCertificate

      protected void checkCertificate(DMTClient client) throws CertificateExpiredException, CertificateNotYetValidException
      Checks the validity of the specified client's certificate.
      Parameters:
      client - client to validate
      Throws:
      CertificateExpiredException - if client's certifiate is expired
      CertificateNotYetValidException - if client's certiticate is not yet valid
      NullPointerException - if client is null

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      formatted date-time string, not null
      Throws:
